definition: to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)

mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
surname Li
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate

sentences.english: Their personality publicity, Zhuo without Kwan, seeking means of differentiating itself.
sentences.chinese: 她们个性张扬，卓而不群，追求标新立异。

sentences.english: The author seems to strain after novelty.
sentences.chinese: 作者似乎在力图标新立异。

sentences.english: To always negate is not the way to create what is new and original.
sentences.chinese: 一味的否定并非就是标新立异。

definition: sensationalism/vulgar claptrap to please the crowds/playing to the gallery/demagogy
to be unconventional/independence of action
to display originality (idiom); to do things differently
modern/fashionable
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
hidebound by convention (idiom)
not follow the beaten track/have an original style
not stick to one pattern
gaudy/flashy (but without substance)
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
offbeat/alternative/avant-garde/unconventional/weird
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
individuality/personality
not following the crowd/to go against the tide
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
